pageContext.claim: “Of the 11 candidates we campaigned with during the last week, 9 won last night. This vigorous campaigning stopped the blue wave that they talked about. I don't know if there ever was such a thing, but could've been. If we didn't do the campaign, probably there could've been. And the history really will see what a good job we did in the final couple of weeks in terms of getting some tremendous people over the finish line.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump spoke too soon at this post-election news conference, before all the races had been called. In the end, it was undeniable that Democrats rode a blue wave to claim the House majority by winning a net 40 seats. His numbers were off at the time he made these comments, too. He had campaigned for 13 candidates in the last week before the election, eight of whom had won.
